website_summaries.verdict: The Sonos Play:5 shrinks the Sonos streaming music experience down to a compact single-speaker system with great sound, which you can control from any iOS device or Android smartphone.
pros: controlled from any iPhone, iPod Touch, iPad, or Android smartphone using a free app
impressive sound from a compact, single housing
streams Internet-based radio and audio services, plus your own digital music collection from any Mac, PC, or NAS drive
simple setup, particularly if you already own a Sonos system
expandable to up to 31 additional rooms (with the purchase of additional Sonos players)
cons: While the Play:5 can wirelessly interact with other Sonos products, you'll need a hard-wired connection or the $49 wireless bridge accessory if it's your only Sonos component

customer_reviews.title: No customer service for hardware problems
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a fantastic speaker out of the box. I started pushing Sonos on all my friends and family. Now I feel horrible because I've trapped them all in a den of horrible customer service. This speaker no longer works. It has a nearly constant hiss with random extremely loud pops and crackles. If you search for this problem you will find the internet is rife with examples. Sonos support is geared 100% towards the software, app, and account linking. They don't care at all about hardware issues, not even in the support form as an option. I was told to go buy a new one, these are unserviceable. Didn't last 2 years, sitting in one place unmoved and undisturbed.
customer_reviews.author: undeadpixels

customer_reviews.title: Product is not supported by company anymore
customer_reviews.text: Product just got legacy'd by company. Would not suggest buying. End of software updates In May the following products in your system will be classified as legacy and no longer receive software updates and new features. This will affect your listening experience. Bridge Serial: 000E58E7xxxxx Play:5 (Gen 1) Sonos Serial: 000E585Fxxxxx Play:5 (Gen 1) Sonos Serial: 000E588Cxxxxx Legacy products were introduced between 2005 and 2011 and, given the age of the technology, do not have enough memory or processing power to sustain future innovation. Please note that because Sonos is a system, all products operate on the same software. If modern products remain connected to legacy products after May, they also will not receive software updates and new features.
customer_reviews.author: Randall F

customer_reviews.title: garbage product with limited bandwidth
customer_reviews.text: garbage product with limited bandwidth The Sonos Connect wireless receiver I am using with this product is not capable to transfer stereo channels in real time. The sound is interrupted peridically to allow the crappy product to jump to a new time stamp. Choosing compressed sound in the settings solves this problem and opens another one: almost 3 seconds of normal sound must be piped into the compression algorithm before transfering it. That will make for very funny movie effects with actors talking at length and their voices being transferred next day.
customer_reviews.author: xxx

customer_reviews.title: NO LONGER SUPPORTED BY SONOS - BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: We bought this unit less than 5 years ago and today I got a notice today that it will no longer be supported, and if used "Over time this is likely to disrupt access to services and overall functionality." The speaker itself still sounds great and works perfectly. We have other audio equipment that works perfectly fine after 10-15 years (speakers, receivers, etc.). For a relatively expensive piece of audio equipment to potentially not be usable after only 5 years is very disappointing and will cause me to not buy any future SONOS products for fear of them becoming obsolete quickly as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with Sonos.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review 7/28/15 I bought another Sonos Play 5 for my 80 year old dad. He loves it. I had to convince him that his 30 year old Sansui receiver just didn't cut it. He loves this. ____ I have a Sonos Connect to play streaming music through my stereo and a couple of Sonos Play:1's to fill in the sound across the room. Then I got the Sonos Play:5. It sounds really great and I use it in the other room as a stand alone speaker. I'm very happy with this. Sonos is great stuff. I got a great deal on the Play:5 from the Amazon Warehouse. Good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Adams

customer_reviews.title: Short Speaker Life + High Price = Poor Value
customer_reviews.text: One of our two Play 5 speakers quit within two years, similar to several other reviews here. Sonos refused to extend the warranty, instead offering another speaker at $129 each. We took this as a sign Sonos knows about the product defect and won’t stand behind their product and suffer the losses. What a waste of our money. We’ll buy future speakers from a brand like Bose that has been in this business decades rather than the newer Sonos who doesn’t seem to know what they are doing and doesn't care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Holman

customer_reviews.title: I thoroughly enjoy listening to my music
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Play 5 from Amazon in 2013, so I have lived with it for almost 2 years. I thoroughly enjoy listening to my music, it fills the room completely. I bought one speaker and it is quite enough. It has a sub-woofer built in and you can opt to add a Sonos sub if wanted. I use my Samsung Galaxy S4 (Android) to run the Sonos app. I've connect both my Amazon music and Spotify to the app. I also have complete access to the music on my home network (wifi) server. I absolutely love the sound, the ease of installation and the options for music that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product in general
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 play 5's paired in living room and a couple of play 1s in other areas. Fantastic product in general, with some cons that you might care about: 1. Probably will never work with Amazon Prime. 2. Is expensive. List price for my config is 1200. 3. You need the 5's to get line in (mostly at least; other options exist but don't seem great to me) 4. Occasionally loses connection to my SAN. I need to reset everything wifi/san once a month or so. 5. No good way of playing computer or phone output to speakers, so can't play you tube, etc on them. Be nice if they had a driver for that.
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Selfridge

customer_reviews.title: Not very compatible
customer_reviews.text: Great sound but it fails connection all the time and has many errors with spotify. Not very compatible with software (spotify interface malfunction) or other hardware (airport express, optoma projector). There is a delay between image and sound when you want to use it as a speaker to whatch a movie, I have try to solve this in many ways without any success
customer_reviews.author: Alfredo J Orfila

customer_reviews.title: The Apple of Music devices- easy setup, now works with SmartThings!
customer_reviews.text: Wow- one of the easiest things to setup that I've ever used. I really bought this for SmartThings, which now integrates with it. So, when motion detectors (sold separately!) sense me going into the living room first thing in the morning, SmartThings tells this bad boy to give me the daily weather report, which it does. That is so Jetsons. You can also set it up to bark like a dog if someone approaches your house and you're not at home, but that setup would require lots of extra stuff which is not included. Point being, I use this as the voice of my Smart house. Sound quality is very good, but not as good as a decent setup.
customer_reviews.author: Pd

customer_reviews.title: It's a not just a wifi speaker, it's a Smart OS Speaker.
customer_reviews.text: I own Bose SoundTouch 20, but switch to Sonos Play 5. the Bose has bug with AirPlay that make it give up on him. Then I found Sonos is much better than AirPlay, since Sonos is downloading and playing by it's own. Once select the music by any Sonos app, you can power off your phone and the speaker will still play. this mean the speaker has some kind of OS can act like a smart phone. Sonos can also play from a NAS network storage directly, while AirPlay is just use as the speaker to replace the iPhone's speaker, you can't make a call or open other app and keep the music play.
customer_reviews.author: chao ouyang

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases ever made
customer_reviews.text: I was not interested in spending $400 for the Play 5 however my husband talked me in to it as a Christmas present to ourselves and it turns out to be one of the best purchases we have ever made. It has great sound, many different streaming options as well as plays all the songs we have purchased. We use it as our alarm and wake up every morning to it. We also have one in our kitchen and love to listen to our favorite tunes while making dinner. I now want a Sonos in every room. If I had to give it one negative...it doesn't play Amazon Prime music.
customer_reviews.author: CJ and Paul

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is just the best system for music
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is just the best system for music, I love them. This supplier was an excellent price with prompt delivery and perfect packaging. Sonos system can use their own speakers, or your speakers with a Sonos connect amp, or your own stereo system or home theater with a sonos connect. Works with any smart phone, and your PC or tablet, and they all work at the same time. So in the lounge, your family member with a iPhone can turn the volume up or down, whilst in the bedroom someone else can use their samsung or whatever to change the music in just one room or all rooms. Amazing technology.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and defective.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was only so-so for the price. Had two replacements for this product due to faulty electronics. One I had to pay for even thought it was clear that Sonos knew it made a faulty product. Stay clear.
customer_reviews.author: JustinK

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect on streaming music through Wifi!
customer_reviews.text: Connection was a breeze, however, streaming music was not so smooth. Music would pause or disconnect for while playing. The location of super power Wifi router, bridge, and Sonos 5 was within 10 feet. Well, now I doubt whether I can add additional Sonos speakers without the same issue. The fix on the issue was LAN line connection to both bridge and Sonos 5. So much for wireless solution. I tried to impress my wife with the new wireless speaker technology but she was first to point out the random mute in streaming music. Is this something that Sonos can fix with a firmware update? I do have latest update per installation step.
customer_reviews.author: PowerUser101

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally easy to set up and amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: One note of caution - if you have a Comcast router, the wireless set up will not work for you right out of your router. You need to have an auxiliary wireless router hooked up to what Comcast provides. There does not seem to be a patch in the works and I assume that is due to agreements signed by Comcast with networks and/or other music providers. Easy work around, just get a cheap wireless router. From out of the box to playing music this took less than fifteen minutes. Incredibly intuitive, great interface on the apps and super easy to install each part of the system. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: best speaker system ever
customer_reviews.text: We love our Sonos. We have three play5's and one play1. They are so easy to set up (no wires besides the power cord) and the quality is amazing. The iphone controller app is easy enough to use, and it's great to be able to control the music in different rooms, group them all together, set alarms, use for the TV, etc. Plus they can be moved just by unplugging and relocating! Would definitely recommend everyone try Sonos if they are looking to "wire" their entire house, but even just having one was great (until we eventually added components when we could afford to).
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts, but doesn't last too long !!
customer_reviews.text: It was great while it lasted, but it lasted only for a couple of years with very moderate usage. I was happy with it for the first 2 years. But then the sound started fading off every few seconds, making it impossible to listen to anything on this speaker. I wrote to the customer care , and they were prompt in responding that they can't to anything else but to replace it with the newer model for $250. I spent almost $500 on this 2 years back and I don't want to spend another $250 on the next gen of the same product. I would spend my money on more reliable products
customer_reviews.author: SAJITH K SADANANDAN

customer_reviews.title: Love my Sonos!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where to begin. My Sonos system was easy to setup. It works like a charm. The sound is amazing for a product its size. I have since bought anouther Play:5 and a Sonos Connect:Amp to go with my Bose outside speakers. There is just not a better suite of products better for adding audio to a home. I would even argue than it is better than hardwiring speakers into new construction in many ways. I don't think many would argue that it is the easiest and least expensive way to add great audio to an existing home. I will most certainly be purchasing additional components in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Bone

customer_reviews.title: The app for choosing programming and setting the volume is easy to download and use
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this system a lot! The sound is phenomenal for a device this size. The app for choosing programming and setting the volume is easy to download and use. We are puzzled, though, why some free internet-based stations we find one day are not there when we look for them again on a later day. We're still learning, though, so maybe we'll solve that puzzle with a little more experience. We recommend Sonos Play 5 and look forward to expanding with additional speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Fran

customer_reviews.title: Many thanks...
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought the Sonos 5 through Amazon (Amazon, I love you for a million reasons) but not only does the Sonos 5 produce wonderful music, but the Customer Service at Sonos is the best. Have you ever purchased a product where you all but pulled your hair out because you couldn't reach the manufacturer, much less ever receive a call back? So it's a blessing when the customer service is excellent. The people at Sonos are easy to reach (they actually provide a 1-800#), friendly to talk to, and patient bordering on the saintly. Love the product, love the people behind it. All the best. Ken Fink
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for a room
customer_reviews.text: Connects well, no drop sound. Good sound for a room, it does lack a little bass but it sounds much better than the play1 (higher price) Combined with another speaker and adding the bass sounds really good (expensive though) Over wifi can't play from youtube yet play5 has the aux option that allows to connect sound source. I have a vynil record player which sounds great through these. I wish Sonos had outdoor speakers
customer_reviews.author: Buksi

customer_reviews.title: An audiophile gets a lesson
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes easy access trumps sound quality. I have been an audiophile most of my adult life. And yet, for the last couple of years, I've listened more to this than my main stereo. It's just so darned convenient. The sound is good enough...the interface is great though and the ease of placement (portability) makes this a household favorite. I definitely recommend checking it out. In white it is pretty easy to place without looking out offensive...
customer_reviews.author: D. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: SONOS! Where have you been all my life?!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, too dramatic? Well yes, this this is an awesome speaker system. Wireless and always synced with other Sonos speakers. Right now I have this paired with Play 5 and Play 3 for downstairs music. I will need to expand downstairs once I have extra money. The Sonos app is also easy to use and fast, nothing but good things about the speaker and app combo. This will change the way you listen to music. In addition, I also output the audio from my Mac Mini to the Play 5 and the music and audio/video when watching movies is synced perfectly throughout the entire speaker ecosystem, awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Big Dawgs Fam

customer_reviews.title: Return to Music
customer_reviews.text: For some time my Vandersteens have been broken and repair is expensive. My wife wants only smaller speakers in the house. What is the solution? Well, it is Sonus 5. A marvelous system. We have only one speaker now but will get more. Yes, a Sonus is not a Vandersteen. But to be realistic, over the years listening critically has been harder and harder. The Sonus system is very good. It is not audiophile. For the first time in a long time we are back to listening to music and enjoying it very much. I have shown this system to a number of people and all are impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Smith

customer_reviews.title: just go straight for the best and get a Play
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with the other Sonos speakers, just go straight for the best and get a Play:5. Scrounge the money, do whatever you have to do, but do not compromise when it comes to the Sonos experience. The Play:5 is probably overpriced, but it delivers solid sound for large spaces. I've got two and thinking about my third.
customer_reviews.author: Javi

customer_reviews.title: I love love love this!
customer_reviews.text: So far so very good! I have had it set-up for about three days, mostly streaming music from an iPad. It was stupidly easy to set-up. I am using it in a large, vaulted ceiling living room. I listen to a lot of instrumental/orchestral music plus contemporary Christian, and the sound is exactly as I hoped. The lows don't overwhelm but fill the room and the highs are clear without distortion. I can't wait until the budget allows me to add to the system. (I saw the whole system demo in a store as part of a home theater system.)
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Kid

customer_reviews.title: Sonos Excels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased SONOS 2 years ago and now it is installed "wirelessly" throughout my house. Everyone who sees and hears SONOS is impressed. I needed music in my garden so I purchased the SONOS S5. It arrived yesterday and took 5 minutes or less to set up. No other product is as easy to set up (especially if you already have SONOS installed). The sound quality is great and now I have "portability" to access to internet based radio and more than 800 computer stored albums from any location. Although I have only one controller, the software is now available for "Android" phones -- I mention this because SONOS is great about updating software to make music even more accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound. Flawless Connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, SONOS simply works. I've never had the connection to this unit fail. It is truly a wireless miracle. Beyond that however, the sound that this relatively small unit creates is a thing of beauty. Crisp highs, gorgeous low bass, it's truly amazing. I use it in a great room about 25' x 15' and it fills the entire room with gorgeous full sound. Sounds equally great at both hushed and high volumes. If you're on the fence, go for it. You won't be disappointed. For the extra money, the sound is far superior to the Play:3. (Which is by no means bad.)
customer_reviews.author: A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Sonos Products - Planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Planned obsolescence by Sonos. Check out recent news on Sonos. They only support their products for a short period of time. I have over $3000 in products that Sonos will no longer support. In pursuit of profit Sonos has thrown early adopters under the bus.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Great device - not so great support.
customer_reviews.text: Great wireless sound. Surprising depth of sound from a relatively small speaker. The Sonos system provides nearly seamless internet music or music from a wireless device. It allows multiple room sound from the same source or different sources at the same time. Listen to Sirius in the kitchen and music from your I-Pod in the living room or bedroom. Great product once you get past the hook up. Not too difficult to hook up. However, if you have problems with the hookup, expect a long wait for any phone support.
customer_reviews.author: dcs

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Music System
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep my review short and sweet - SONOS is absolutely incredible. We have a PLAY:5 on the first floor and a PLAY:1 in the bedroom and I couldn't be more pleased with them. Whether we're playing Pandora, SiriusXM or our iTunes collection, the music is crystal clear and there's nothing else like SONOS on the market. Don't take just my word for it, read Consumer Reports, other consumer reviews, etc. and you'll see that this is always at the top of the music system list. Thanks SONOS!
customer_reviews.author: seek7500x

customer_reviews.title: Finally---Google Play Music works as a Sonos Service!
customer_reviews.text: I have had three Sonos 5 speakers in rooms in my home for the last two years, and I love the sound quality and versatility of the system. But until today, there was one big exception to my favor for the Sonos speaker lineup : Sonos and Google seemed to be at odds about ever supporting Google Play Music on Sonos speakers. That changed today (4/10/2014) with the release of Sonos app that supports Google Play Music. Bravo Google and Sonos, for agreeing to play nicely together!
customer_reviews.author: RLTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Sonus Play:5 is the perfect wireless player, great application software, impressive sound
customer_reviews.text: We have the Sonus router and a Play:3 as well. The Play:5 is for rooms where you really care about the quality of the sound. the Play:3 is more for locations where you simply want some background music than a quality listening experience. The application which runs on most devices (tablets, smartphones, PCs, Macs) make it easy to access your library of music as well as lots of online music sources. It is a little expensive, but has changed how we listen to music around our home because its become immediately accessible.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Quayle

customer_reviews.title: Best music system ever!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who does not know about this wonderful wireless sound system, you should definitely take a look. I am now able to choose my music (whether my own or on Pandora or an International station or any number of other options) with a tap or two of my controller. The sound is awesome; I can control the volume by individual room; I can choose the MUSIC by individual room! The best part for me is that I can go anywhere in my home and hear my music. The system is easily expandable and affordable. Best thing I have ever done!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Hilaire

customer_reviews.title: Worth the expense
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This system is a complete ripoff. It is NOT an independent music system and you are entirely dependent on the Sonos website & app. They change things on a whim, and you are then stuck with the world's most expensive doorstops unless you invest in the newest operating system. I'm sorry, but I am not investing in a new computer because Sonos insists on being trendy. The system worked well for several years, and then they just shut me out. That is is criminally unethical.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good sound for the living room
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Play:5 after being extremely impressed with the Play:1 and thinking that the 5 will sound better in a larger room. Adding the speaker to the existing network was easy and I like the fact that it has an audio line-in to play music from a phone or tablet directly. The sound is good (I play mostly classical and other orchestral music such as soundtracks) but getting a second Play:1 and pairing them would have been an equally good option for me. It's not that the sound on the Play:5 is not good but rather that the Play:1 is impressive indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: SONOS knocks it out of the park
customer_reviews.text: This is one amazing system! Very well designed and thought out from the user's perceptive. My wife and I use this almost every day. Controlling it from our cell phones, her iPad or one of our numerous computers. Sensible controller software updates. My wish list would like it to integrate with Google's Music Player system. I am thinking about order a couple more speakers in the coming weeks - to cover some other rooms and areas of our home. Thanks SONOS for an amazing system!
customer_reviews.author: G Clark

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Its a great product.
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Great media device. Can play from various sources. crystal clear sound, and EXCELLENT media library indexing. Easy to search and play anything. Best source of listening music for me. ANYONE considering home audio with pre-installed wires during home construction, just give up and buy this one. lot cheaper, flexible and you will enjoy it, and more than anything, will listen to your music. I have 3 units and HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Jadu Gem

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome speaker and system in general
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome speaker and system in general. Have heard about these for a while now but never really checked into it till now. WOW!!! is all I can say. Great sound, awesome user interface experience and just so many ways to enjoy it. Can't wait to get more for the other rooms in my home. Definitely a lifetime customer at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R Carey

customer_reviews.title: I love my SONOS!
customer_reviews.text: I got this speaker in order to listen to my music around the house. Let's just say that since I purchased my Sonos system I have fallen in love with the whole setup! I can listen to Pandora, TuneIn Radio, Spotify, Amazon Music, and my private MP3 collection. I can listen to different stations in different rooms at the same time. Setup is easy, I can control it from my computer, my wife's iPhone, and my Android phone. This is probably the best thing to happen to home audio since digital music. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Teknurd

customer_reviews.title: Ordered some more
customer_reviews.text: Just as I expected, the sound quality is superb. It looks good anywhere I put it in the living room and it really lightens up the room with its crisp and clear sound. Once I got it, I decided to purchase a pair of Play:1s and a Sonos Bridge. I'm giving it a 4 star, though, because I can't link it to my amazon music account. Just recently, Sonos can be linked to your amazon music account, so I decided to upgrade my original review and give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! After reading how to set it up and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! After reading how to set it up and their new software update that allows setup over WiFi, I decided not to buy the bridge and see what happens. This is what "plug and play" was always meant to be! Couldn't have been more simple! Actually, I didn't even have to plug anything in. I just downloaded their software to my laptop and phone, it recognized the SONOS, as if by Magic, I typed in my WiFi code and, that was it.
customer_reviews.author: JEsquire

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is a great system to provide music throughout one's home. The setup was very easy, and we haven't had any problems in the 6 months while using this system. The individual parts of Sonos are sleek looking and match our furniture and sound system well. The sound quality is great. The Sonos software is decent and we like the ability to stream various internet radio stations for free. While expensive, I haven't found any systems that work like this and is as versatile. The only thing I would change would be able to use my computer speakers when I have the Sonos software loaded to play the music.
customer_reviews.author: rg-s

customer_reviews.title: i love to work with music around me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a convert. While I'm no audiophile, i love to work with music around me, and love even more having music everywhere. It's nice to move from living room to office, to bedroom, and the same song is playing. It's also handy when i want one playlist where I am and the wife wants another where she is. This purchase, lead to another, so win for SONOS LOL
customer_reviews.author: John Wilker

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised and pleased with the responsiveness of the Sonos representative
customer_reviews.text: The sound of these speakers is incredible for their size, but what I was impressed with was the customer service. I had a problem with one of the speakers and I steeled myself for the frustration that I have gotten used to with "customer service representatives". I was surprised and pleased with the responsiveness of the Sonos representative. he was very helpful and seemed genuinely concerned that the speaker was defective. I received a replacement speaker promptly without any of the usual hassle. I would heartily recommend buying products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: JFM

customer_reviews.title: Sonos S5 is a Great Addition to your Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos S5 is a pricey option ($399) but it has turned out to be a very worthwhile investment in good sound. It has the amazing sound of a similar sized Bose system but can go anywhere within the range of Sonos wireless field and where there is an electrical socket. When the weather is patio-favorable I simply take the S5 outside and plug it in. No other wires to mess with and wonderful sound. My remote also works outside so I get thousands of songs plus my own library of 7500 MP3's to choose from. Sonos is the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Happy Sonos user
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of music on my NAS drive. I can easily access all of that music, and the sound quality is awesome. The ability to select music sources from my iPad or my iPhone is great--song selection, volume etc. Previously I had used an Apple Air Port to stream music from iTunes to my living room, but this is a better solution because I can go directly to my stored music bypassing iTunes.
customer_reviews.author: jsfremont

customer_reviews.title: Sonos PLAY:5
customer_reviews.text: This sounds very good. I think it is comparable to Bose Sound docks, but the Play:5 have their own sound. They sound more open than the Bose, but don't have as much bass as Bose. Because of this, I think the play:5 will mate excellently with a Sonos Sub. With a Sonos Bridge, all you have to do to set it up is plug it in and push the up volume and mute button together and the system will find it. Sounds good and is effortless to set up. Plus it can be moved to anywhere in your house with Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: musicway

customer_reviews.title: Very clear, strong audio.
customer_reviews.text: This unit produces room-filling well-balanced audio. Its probably going to be the starting piece of a complete, wireless home audio system. First, though, I'll have to save up some more cash ;-) Easy as pie to manage via my computer and iPad.
customer_reviews.author: EspressoGuy

customer_reviews.title: Big sound, little box, few wires...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a little difficult, mainly getting the software installed properly (actually had to go to a restore point due to some of the issues, long story). After the software was on board, it identified and ran the hardware flawlessly. I got the wireless bridge with it and love the variety of online radio stations available. Only downside is not being able to get to certain streamed media, though I'm working on figuring out how to get to these (mostly public radio podcasts and such). Huge sound from such a small box, nice design, and the web interface is great.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: If it is unreliable who cares what it sounds like. Going wireless through WIFI is a good idea ...
customer_reviews.text: If it is unreliable who cares what it sounds like. Going wireless through WIFI is a good idea however it breaks frequently. This means I need to take time to troubleshoot it and get it working again. If I could go back in time I would not have bought the Sonos speakers I have. The single most aggravating piece of technology in a house filled with this stuff. BTW- The sound is okay - not amazing.
customer_reviews.author: reasonable expectations

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: I have several Sonos components and this product seemed to be the ticket for a spare room. I was a little put-off by the price but it ended up being worth it if you just consider the ease of use setup. Sounds great and easy to use. The only issue I have is that it sometimes forget to automatically transfer to line-in when a device is connected to the line-in jack as it was set to do and I have to hunt down a phone or controller when it fails to auto-transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Works as easily and as well as they say!
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to give a big, wordy review, but the simple truth is Sonos has done the work so we don't have to. We bought the ZP90 and S5 at the same time. Both were "plug and play" (except for a small bump courtesy of our Norton Security Suite, which the installation diagnosed and told us how to correct!) It's all a bit more expensive than we wanted (we bought a refurbished iPod Touch as the remote - and it's great!), but we have music all over the house - it's AWESOME!!! P.S. All of the internet radio that's now available (especially Pandora) is really great, and really incredible!!
customer_reviews.author: Deep Listener

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers! Have several of these around the house and they work as advertised. Sound is great, and the controller app does its job. Streaming audio couldn't be easier with these. Any issue I've ever had has been solved with a router reset or a reset of the speaker - which hasn't happened frequently. Very simple to install and operate, and unless you are a hardcore audiophile the audio quality will make you very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set up
customer_reviews.text: Got the SONOS system instead of cutting my ceiling drywall and running in-ceiling speakers. Sound quality is superb, no interference with my home wireless network (I checked with a wifi-analyzer!) and completely relocatable around the house. The computer/android have does have a few bugs, but mostly you can set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: TheHelpful1

customer_reviews.title: Found a new love.....
customer_reviews.text: Sorry Bose...for I have found a new love.....this system blows the doors off....crisp highs and bone shaking lows....just added the Play1 pair with the Play 5. Can't wait to get the sub woofer and the sound bar.....excuse me while I change the tune......the only dig I have is it took 30 minutes to set up the first component. Had to call the 800 Tech line and walk through the sysytem updates. Once that was taken care of everything has delivered as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these and they are absolutely outstanding. The sound quality is amazing and the connection to the network was very easy. We love the portability, it is so easy to bring it out to the Lanai plug it in and in a matter of seconds it connects to the network. It is not inclement weather proof so don't leave it outside. Amazon did an excellent job packaging and shipping as usual.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL LALONDE

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but way overpriced. But a pair of Play1s instead.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent speaker, the only one with line in, and headphones out. I wish they added simple line out, but Sonos is a bit deliberate when it comes to enabling your OTHER sound system. This speaker's main fault is it's insane price. It is NOT worth the $500 price tag, sorry. Buy a pair of Play1s and it will sound just as well, but in Stereo. Trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantin Gredeskoul

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was one my most exciting purchases ever. The android controller works flawlessly for pandora. the setup could not have been easier (it involves pressing 1-2 buttons and that's it. The sound quality is amazing. Its not surround sound but very clear. I also like the bass and treble control on my phone. Took it to my patio and was not disappointed. All in all you cant go wrong with this thing, if you can afford these...
customer_reviews.author: sameer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my wife but we equally enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: This unit has completely impressed me and my wife just loves being able to play music from Pandora any time she wants. This unit is only wireless if you add a Sonos Bridge to your setup otherwise you will need to plug it in to your home network. We have only had this for a month so I haven't tried all the internet radio stations and other apps that are available but it has been easy to manage from either of our smart phones.
customer_reviews.author: K. Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Sonos and Apple AirPlay
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit to use by our pool and I was looking for something I could use with AirPlay so that people can stream music from their iPhone/iPad or computers. Sonos posted instructions on their website and yes, you do need to purchase Apple's Airport Express to complete the setup but once I did (including updating the software on the Sonos) it worked as advertised. The sound quality is really good and powerful in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best way to have music playing
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos system is the best thought-out way of having music in the home. The Play5 is overkill for most rooms; if I had it to do over again I'd have chosen the Play3. That said, this whole system, from the Bridge to the Play5 to the PC, Mac interface through the iPhone and iPad interfaces is simple the best interface imaginable for all the music in the world to make its way into the home. I love SONOS!
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Cone

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have the deep-feeling bass of my old Kenwood/Advent combo from the 70s, but those are long gone (and of course were a lot bigger.) For the first time in a long while I have something fine enough to experience good music. The Sonos application has a lot of sensible things about it. While it's ocassionally buggy (the Windows application) and some things are not as easy as they should be, it works well enough and it's a pleasure to have a consolidated app for bouncing between Pandora and Rhapsody! Lovin' it.
customer_reviews.author: RMK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome even for an old cheap person who doesn't want to spend much on electronics
customer_reviews.text: These were much more price than I wanted for speakers, but it is awesome. The app is very easy to use, and it has local radio stations. I can move this to my garage and other rooms and have instant radio and music.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krot

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for cost difference from Play 1
customer_reviews.text: The general reviews were great but i personally preferred the sound from 2 stereo paired Play 1 speakers. I found there was very little difference in sound quality between two Play 1 and one Play 5. There wasn't the deep bass nor the glass breaking tinkles from tweeters that you'd expect. The Play 1 will give you more flexibility in use. Better than usual stereo placement was to place the Play 1 diagonally opposite each other. I imagine the investment should go towards the sub woofer... haven't got one yet will try it out in a store first.
customer_reviews.author: A. K. J

customer_reviews.title: Great single speaker
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 16 year old son's birthday. He can play his own music in his room. Didn't need a full stereo set up to power the speaker. We are very happy with our Sonos system, although it can be a bit temperamental at times. Only downside it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L., Gbury CT

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wireless system
customer_reviews.text: I'm a lifelong music lover and had Sonos recommended by a friend. I have a very large music collection (5000 LPs and 8000 CDs) and saw this as an easy way to access internet radio and all my items that were burned to disk. To start, I bought a single S5, a Zonebridge, and a ZonePlayer 90 to connect to my stereo system, plus an iTouch to use as a controller versus the Sonos controller unit. Setup could not have been easier and the sound quality is awesome. The free app for the iTouch works great as a controller, plus I use the desktop app. I liked it so much I've ordered two more S5 units! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: JazzImprov5732

customer_reviews.title: 5s and a sub and couldn't be happier. I can bring the entire "system" outside for ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first at going wireless, but bought a Play:1 and a Play:5. Now I have 2 more Play:5s and a sub and couldn't be happier. I can bring the entire "system" outside for pool parties, put them in every room for our cleaning music or in the living room for great sounding movies. The system works very well with my Android device and is easy to set up, easy to customize and well designed all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There is a reason for you to have Play:5 somewhere in your house...
customer_reviews.text: True to the Sonos legacy. Powerful, very clear sound, value for money. Added advantage of plugging in all sorts of sound sources via the jack which is not available in any of the other sonos speakers, but once you have one of these speakers in your house you can stream music from any of such jacked in sources to any other speakers anywhere in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Adeniji Olusegun Samuel

customer_reviews.title: and the wireless is amazing. I thought this would be like my bluetooth ...
customer_reviews.text: Fanastic sound, and the wireless is amazing. I thought this would be like my bluetooth speaker using my phone as the play deviceand draining the battery, but it actually handles the music pandora/iheartradio/amazonmusic/googleplay all internally i can even shut off my phone or computer and have the music continue to play. Saving up for my next peice of sonos equipment now.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, quality
customer_reviews.text: Heard this speaker system at a friends . Finally came into this century and are totally wireless. No more turning on amp, to turn on CD, to fix speaker, then slip in a disc!! Buying 2 more speakers. Amazing sound, quality, and Pandora, with all the options( Sade Radio😃😃!!) could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: mary a

customer_reviews.title: Best sound product I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Best sound product I have ever purchased. I was sold on the Bose SoundDock Portable. I own two and would always recommend. Never again. Sonos! Sonos! Sonos! With the iphone/android apps, the ability to play independent sound in our rooms or unified sound in all rooms is AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Jack Koen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my man cave.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished remodeling my garage. Turned it into a mechanics man cave. Of course I need my music while tinkering on my rides and the Sonos Play 5 was perfect for the task. It fills the garage with sound and I can control it with my cellphone. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Corvette Ken

customer_reviews.title: I like it...plenty of audio volume for outdoor parties
customer_reviews.text: I've got all three sizes now and this one works great just like the other two (Mac user). None of them are audiophile-quality speakers but they are fine for my needs...one in the workshop, one in the kitchen and now this one in the outdoor gazebo to provide party music.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Miraculous Invention
customer_reviews.text: This is phenomenal, and easily worth the $448 I spent. The sound is exquisite, and it's mind-boggling to think of how much music is at one's fingertips. Just this morning I listened to Nick Drake, Jeri Southern, Brook Benton, and Mel Torme; they all sounded great. To anybody who has reservations about buying this, please take my word: you won't regret it. I can only vouch for the Sonos 5--haven't heard the 1 or 3.
customer_reviews.author: NY Werewolf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sounds soothe the savage beast
customer_reviews.text: I love Love LOVE Sonos. I have a several components and they all work seamlessly, easily and bring news, music, and sound to every room. I even take one outside and my wireless booster enables me to listen on the patios. If you want ONE music system - yes, they're not inexpensive - then this is THE solution. I've used for 4 years and love it every single day.
customer_reviews.author: DogFish Dude

customer_reviews.title: Wow, we love our Sonos system
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe we didn't get one earlier. It's totally reshaped our life to have music in every room of our house. The Play:5 is great for our open plan living room/dining room/kitchen. Good balance overall and a good sense that the music is coming from more than just one location. The Sonos setup experience is superb and the app, recently updated, for the iPhone works very well. We love that we can connect to all of our favorite streaming services easily. Recommend this lifestyle upgrade to anyone. Worth the price of admission.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kurz

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Home Sound System
customer_reviews.text: The Sonos S5 delivers excellent sound from our iTunes Library. Additionally the very intuitive programming has made this unit our choice as a morning alarm (with internet radio stations playing far better than our prior analog versions). The fade in of the volume in the alarm mode is a great improvement from our prior clock radio. It works so effectively that we are using the unit in our bedroom and, shortly, will purchase an additional S5 for the originally intended Studio application.
customer_reviews.author: jaxjim

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to setup and wire free sound system across your whole house.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great sound. Easy setup. Great for integrating a sound system across a whole house. Great for offices/stores. Cons: Not great for just buying one speaker, because you can get a cheaper, quality speaker. It only makes sense if you are buying several to play the same thing over your whole house/office at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Diggy

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is fine, not great, but ease of use is A#1.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe someday bluetooth will catch up to sonos, but that day is still far away. We use an old iPhone 4 connected to the sonos and it is great. We have both the amplifier hooked up and also a play:5 for the bathroom. It gets used all the time. It is pretty big and doesn't sound as good as more expensive speakers, but I listen to so much more music because it is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Mom

customer_reviews.title: The Sonos 5 is amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just set it up about an hour ago. It's amazing! I had another WIFI speaker. It would lose signal and it drove me crazy! The Sonos sees my WIFI and I have yet to lose the signal. I knew if I could stream movies from Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc, I should be able to get music without dropping out. Besides playing the music on my Android, and Pandora, it has radio stations you can stream, too. The sound is incredible. This is the solutions to my music issues. It fits in my entertainment center yet has a huge sound!
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Golomb

customer_reviews.title: fills a room and more
customer_reviews.text: Not only fills a room, but half my house with high quality music. Friends that come over are usually stunned by the amount of sound and bass coming out of such a small package. I do plan on buying more in the future, but they definitely are not cheap, but then again, sound systems rarely are.
customer_reviews.author: Jvoss

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality not what I had expected
customer_reviews.text: I love the Sonos system. I bought two of the 3s and one 5. For the price, I expected them to sound better than they do. I also have trouble with the app (freezes). Still, I like having the option to turn music on and off in different rooms (when the app is working) and I will buy more. I just thought for the price they would sound more like my Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: Looks good with a great sound
customer_reviews.text: Looks good with a great sound. So easy to set up with the software program I downloaded on both our desktop computer and an ipad. Can place it anywhere there is an electrical outlet. Looking forward to using it on our patio this coming summer when no rain predicted.
customer_reviews.author: LYNN TULE

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound and works well once set up
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound and works well once set up. However deducted a star because it was difficult to configure probably because I was following the instructions to set up a new unit, but they must have sent me a used/returned unit since it had already been configured! That makes me a bt mad given the money I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Wanderski

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional sound will astound
customer_reviews.text: I received my S5 yesterday and couldn't be happier. Initially, I had problems getting it to work wirelessly, but Sonos tech support is exceptional. After a little troubleshooting, the tech had me change the wireless channel that the S5 was using - problem solved. Sound quality is on par with my Bose Acoustic Wave. My only compaint is that the superior sound and ease of use will compell me to buy another one :-).
customer_reviews.author: L. BAZEMORE

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Device
customer_reviews.text: Sonos devices are excellent devices. They sound great and are very easy to setup and use. They are very portable. With the bridge device I have formed 3 devices into a single group and the sound is very good. I have had no problem with the signal anywhere in my house or even outside on patio. The app on iOS and Mac are fairly simple to understand without too much confusion. The only thing I wish the app would do is keep track of number of plays when I am using music from my iTunes library, especially for podcasts. If you have the money to spend and you want good sound and ease of use these devices are great.
customer_reviews.author: kofoide

customer_reviews.title: I love having the 1/8" input in the back of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I love having the 1/8" input in the back of the Play:5. I already had a Play:1 and now it's nice seeing how these 2 speakers in adjacent rooms (kitchen & living room) can be sync'd/grouped and controlled. When you make a group that contains all of the speakers, it still lets you set each volume level independently (or all at once if you prefer).
customer_reviews.author: J. King

customer_reviews.title: Outperforms Bose
customer_reviews.text: The top end of the Sonos speaker line-up. Provides strong bass and good range. Very little distortion even at high volumes. I rated only 4 instead of 5 due to price. For the money, might ("might") be better off with two Sonos Play 1's instead of the cost of the 5. I've been very happy with the Sonos products though. Easy setup and great sound. Outperforms my previous Bose system.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: Pick different solution
customer_reviews.text: Another company that tries to force customers to upgrade by removing functionality.
customer_reviews.author: SJR

customer_reviews.title: Love Sono's. Quick and easy to get setup and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love Sono's. Quick and easy to get setup and works very well. Occasional glitches I've noticed where my zones get accidentily broken up, but this may be an issue with the iPAD/iPhone controller app. That said the 5 series speaker sounds very good and is a good ambiance music speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great SOUND Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this unit. I does everything I wanted it to do. It sounds excellent. Only issue is it deops signal with my router. I think it is a ComCast issue or possibly because I have a network cable and wireless signal in use one or the other. They conflict with each other. I have to unplug the network cable and reset the bridge and it comes right back. Other than that I have NO complaints. Don't be afraid to buy this, it's AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love Sonos. I have a house that was built in the 1960's in Florida, so running wires at this point would be a nightmare. With Sonos, my problems are solved. I have 2 Play:1's and a Play:5. The Play 5 sound is outstanding (not that the 1's are poor). I highly recommend Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Acceptable sound good volume, easy to use, and a good compliment for the spotify or deexer users, i use mine with 2 play 1 surround and a boost and works like a charm, is not the best sound but is still good for almost anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Jb

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but nice.
customer_reviews.text: The Play 5 is a serious hi-fi speaker system. These babies are heavy. The Sonos system with control apps on my mac and on my iPhone is really a joy to use. Can listen to great music all the time and don't even have to have the computer on. The sound is everything I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: P. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I was so close to making a mistake and ordering a CD player/Ipod dock type device. This system sounds absolutely great, was less expensive and is way more flexible! The only detail that takes some getting used to was the "que" vs playlists etc, but that only took a few tries before getting the hang of it. I would recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Devine

customer_reviews.title: Superb product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this player about two months ago for its wireless convenience and top notch audio performance, and I have to say, I am more than happy with it! The music quality is absolutely fantastic and the wireless range reaches anywhere easily in my 1800 square foot house. Set up took less than 3 minutes and besides my personal music files it also plays internet radio like Pandora, which really comes in handy for a party when you don't feel like having to be a dj. The bass is also very nice but I purchased the separate SUB and it has the power to shake the whole house!
customer_reviews.author: Joeshine

customer_reviews.title: Play 1 better than Play 5
customer_reviews.text: I love Sonos, but I couldn't tell the difference between the Play 5 and Play 1. I'm returning the Play 5 and likely to purchase a couple Play 1's for the same price. Eventually, I'll have a Sonos speaker in every room except the living room which already has a great surround sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: If you haven't heard one of these you don't know what you are missing. We use ours on almost a daily basis. The sound from the Play 5 is incredible. I definitely plan on adding another one and highly recommend to anyone who enjoys good quality music.
customer_reviews.author: It's Me

product_meta.title: SONOS PLAY:5 Wireless Speaker for Streaming Music (White) (Gen 1) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe original, bigger room, bigger sound SONOS PLAY:5 Wireless Speaker. With 5 integrated speakers powered by 5 digital amps, the PLAY:5 is a HiFi powerhouse of sound that will astound your ears. Wirelessly stream your entire music library, favorite music services, and thousands of radio stations to any room. Set up is simple, and you can expand until every room in your home is packed with music. Control the SONOS PLAY:5 Wireless with free apps for your phone, tablet, and computer.
feature_bullets: The original bigger room, bigger sound wireless speaker with five custom drivers for full-bodied sound at any volume
Connects directly to your home’s Wi-Fi network, no wired connection needed
Wirelessly streams your music library and favorite online music services like Spotify and Pandora
Control your music with the free Sonos Controller app on your phone, tablet, or computer
Start with any Sonos speaker and fill your home with music over time by adding Sonos speakers to other rooms

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars1,079 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #4,654 in Portable Bluetooth Speakers#34,116 in MP3 & MP4 Player Accessories
